	function __gaTrackerIsOptedOut() {

	}

	/* Disable tracking if the opt-out cookie exists. */

         <p style="text-align: center;"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/quiz/start" class="woo-sc-button  green large"><span class="woo-">Want Our Recommendations? Click to Take a Short Quiz</span></a></p> 
         <div class="woo-sc-box no-icon download   full" style="padding-left:15px;background-image:none;"> 
          <strong>Did the chart help you choose a website builder? Have a burning question you want to ask? Leave a comment at the bottom of the page.</strong>
          <br> 
         </div> 
         <div class="woo-sc-box  note large  full"> 
          <h2>Why Did We Include the Website Builders Above in Our Comparison Chart?</h2> 
          <p>We’ve used a wide range of site builders over the years and, like you, we’ve asked a number of questions in order to really understand the differences between the above web builders and how they work. As with anything, with time comes experience and after having invested hundreds – maybe even thousands of hours into each of these web builder tools we’re now in a position to share our own thoughts on the matter.</p> 
          <p>The comparison table above should be your first port of call if you’re new to the world of website builders (and if you’ve given it a look then I’m sure you already have plenty of food for thought!).</p> 
          <p><strong>I can tell you right now that if we’d had all the answers in one place like this, then we would’ve spent a lot less time scratching our heads in confusion and more time designing great websites, that’s for sure!</strong></p> 
          <p>So before you go ahead and pick a web builder, let’s quickly run through the top 4 reasons why we included the above website creators in our comparison chart:</p> 
          <h3 class="topic-title"><span class="dropcap">1.</span>Quick and Easy to Use:</h3> 
          <p>Despite the fact most site builders use drag and drop interfaces, each one has its own look and feel. We wanted to highlight the website builders which, from our experience, are the easiest and quickest to use when building websites. The web builders chosen have been designed to make website creation as easy for you as possible, <strong> especially for non-technical people</strong>. Using a website creator removes that stress of having to code and allows you to simply just drag, drop, click and publish – easy.</p> 
          <h3 class="topic-title"><span class="dropcap">2.</span>You Don’t Need a Huge Budget (or Any Budget at All!):</h3> 
          <p>A major factor that turns a lot of small businesses off the idea of having a website is the high cost associated with web design agencies. Thankfully, not only do website makers put the power back in your hands creatively, but it won’t cost you an arm or a leg either. We’ve included website builders that offer a range of pricing plans to suit whatever needs you have – some even offer a free plan.</p> 
          <h3 class="topic-title"><span class="dropcap">3.</span>Customer Support:</h3> 
          <p>Although website builders are incredibly easy to use, there’s always the chance that you may need additional assistance – such as answering a query about your plan or explaining how to use a tool you’re unfamiliar with. We wanted to include the website builders which offer the best customer support.</p> 
          <h3 class="topic-title"><span class="dropcap">4.</span>How Popular Are These Website Builders:</h3> 
          <p>Website builders are very much like restaurants – if it is good then a lot of people will use it / eat there. The more users a site builder has then the more you can trust it as a quality product – after all, several million people can’t be wrong, can they?<br> </p>
         </div> 
         <div id="overall"></div> 
         <h2><strong><em>Footnotes:</em></strong></h2> 
         <p></p>
         <div class="twocol-one">
          <div class="woo-sc-box no-icon normal  rounded full" style="padding-left:15px;background-image:none;"> 
           <em><strong>[1] Rating</strong>&nbsp;– Scores are based on an average of the scoring above – You should not base your decision solely on the average scores as there are many qualitative / subjective factors that you should consider prior to deciding. &nbsp;Our scoring is to help you narrow your choices, then you should always test out at least 2 of the website builders to see which one you are comfortable with before investing your time and money. &nbsp;</em>
           <p></p> 
           <div id="websites"></div> 
           <p><em><strong>We highly recommend</strong> you read our <a title="Website Builder Reviews" href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/reviews/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">detailed reviews for each website builder</a> as we cover each builder in much more depth in those reviews.</em><br> </p>
           <div class="woo-sc-hr"></div>
           <br> 
           <em><strong>[2] Websites Powered</strong> – Number of websites powered (in millions) by each website builder is based on publicly available information. &nbsp;This does not necessarily equal to the number of active websites, or the number of paying customers, but will give you an indication of its size.</em>
           <p></p> 
           <div id="ai"></div> 
           <p></p>
           <div class="woo-sc-hr"></div>
           <br> 
           <em><strong>[3] Design Assistant (AI – Artificial Intelligence)</strong>: </em>
           <p></p> 
           <div></div> 
           <p><em><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/wixchartadi" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><strong>Wix ADI</strong> (Artificial Design Intelligence)</a> is an AI program that acts like a design assistant for you. It will automatically create the first draft of your website design and layout, insert your content and create a professional looking website for you, automatically. You can continue to edit your website after Wix ADI&nbsp;completes the first draft of your website.</em></p> 
           <div>
            <em>If you have an existing website or social network profiles, Wix ADI will automatically extract data and build it into your website for you.</em>
           </div> 
           <div>
            <em>This is particularly helpful if you want to leverage on AI to do all the initial heavy lifting of website building for you, if you’re not sure how best to design your webpage layouts, or if you just want Wix to quickly build a website for you (and still have it look good). &nbsp;Think of this program as a “Done-For-You” service.</em>
           </div> 
           <div id="design">
            <div class="woo-sc-hr"></div>
            <br> 
            <em><strong>[4] Design Flexibility </strong>– Refers to flexibility of where you can place content, access to HTML / CSS codes to make further customizations or extent of tools provided by website builder to make modifications to design</em>
           </div> 
           <div id="themes"></div> 
           <p></p>
           <div class="woo-sc-hr"></div>
           <br> 
           <em><strong>[5] Themes:</strong>&nbsp;</em>
           <p></p> 
           <ul> 
            <li><em><strong>Wix</strong> has a very <a title="Wix Templates – Making You Look Good" href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wix-templates/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">large library of professionally designed themes</a> that spans across a lot of different industries, so it’s easy to find one that’s suitable for you. &nbsp;</em></li> 
            <li><em><a title="Squarespace Templates – Professional, Polished &amp; Thoughtful" href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/squarespace-templates/" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><strong>Squarespace</strong> themes</a> are responsive and polished – by far the best amongst its peers. </em></li> 
            <li><em><strong>Weebly’s </strong>themes used to be average, but they have improved significantly over time.&nbsp;</em></li> 
           </ul> 
           <p><em>All website builders – or website creators, if you like – are different and have their own unique themes and designs, making web design easy for non-technical people like yourself.</em></p> 
           <p><em>Website builders simplify the technical side of website design by letting you work with pre-existing templates that can be customized using a drag-and-drop interface along with other handy tools. These tools vary by platform but all will allow you to create text, imagery, menus, links and so much more to help your website take shape.</em></p> 
           <p><em>If you want your web design to look good, <strong><a title="Free Website Builder Designer Templates" href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builder-templates/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">click here to see a collection of free beautiful, professional themes</a>.</strong></em></p> 
           <div id="responsive"></div> 
           <p></p>
           <div class="woo-sc-hr"></div>
           <br> 
           <em><strong>[6] Responsive Themes:</strong></em>
           <p></p> 
           <ul> 
            <li><em>All <strong>Squarespace</strong> themes are mobile responsive and as such, all your website content will display nicely across mobile devices.</em></li> 
            <li><em><strong>Weebly </strong>is&nbsp;adding more and more responsive themes over time. &nbsp;They also have over a hundred older themes that are not mobile responsive, but are available for you to choose from. You can use Weebly’s mobile editor to configure the mobile layout for these older themes.</em></li> 
            <li><em><strong>Jimdo</strong> converted all their themes to become mobile responsive, and they currently have 15 themes for you to choose from.</em></li> 
           </ul> 
           <div id="mobile"></div> 
           <p></p>
           <div class="woo-sc-hr"></div>
           <br> 
           <em><strong>[7] Mobile Editor:</strong>&nbsp;</em>
           <p></p> 
           <ul> 
            <li><em><strong>Wix &amp; GoDaddy</strong> mobile editors allow you to hide specific content on your mobile display while keeping these content displayed on your desktop version of your site. &nbsp;This gives you the flexibility to have more control over your visitors’ experience while they are surfing your site on their mobile devices. &nbsp;</em></li> 
            <li><em><strong>Squarespace</strong> doesn’t need&nbsp;a mobile editor as their design themes are fully responsive – meaning your website design&nbsp;is&nbsp;automatically optimized to look good&nbsp;on any mobile devices. &nbsp;</em></li> 
            <li><em>If you know a bit of code, <strong>Jimdo</strong> gives you access to edit the CSS codes of your mobile site – an added flexibility</em>.</li> 
           </ul> 
           <div id="pricing"></div> 
           <p></p>
           <div class="woo-sc-hr"></div>
           <br> 
           <em><strong>[8] Pricing</strong> – Monthly pricing based on annual plans. &nbsp;Monthly price will be a bit higher if you enrolled on month-to-month payment plans. &nbsp;Pricing plans should not be compared directly based on pricing, as each website builder offers different features for their own plans. We have in-depth discussion about pricing plans for <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wix-pricing/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Wix</a>, <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/squarespace-pricing/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Squarespace</a> and <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/weebly-pricing-pro-starter-plans/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Weebly</a> here. We also have more discussions about <a title="Cost To Build A Website – Our Trials &amp; Experiences" href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/cost-to-build-a-website/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">the cost of building a website here</a>.</em>
           <p></p> 
           <p><em>Luckily for you, most of the website builders offer a free plan or trial and have refund periods which removes any financial risk from you.</em></p> 
           <p><em>Free plans and trials are ideal if you’re looking for an online presence and don’t plan on doing too much site personalization. However, if you want more flexibility in the design and functionality of your site then it is worth investing in a premium plan.</em></p> 
           <div id="domain"></div> 
           <p></p>
           <div class="woo-sc-hr"></div>
           <br> 
           <em><strong>[9] Free Domain</strong> – For web builders that offer you free custom domain names, you have to sign up to their annual plans. </em>
           <p></p> 
           <ul> 
            <li><em>For <strong>Wix</strong>, you only get a free domain name if you sign up to their Combo or higher plans. &nbsp;</em></li> 
            <li><em>For <strong>Jimdo</strong>, you get 2 free domain names with their Business Plan, and 1 free domain name with their Pro Plan. &nbsp;</em></li> 
           </ul> 
           <p><em>Not sure how&nbsp;domain names work? See our <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/what-is-a-domain-name-beginners-guide/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">domain name guide for beginners</a>.</em></p> 
           <div id="ssl"></div> 
           <p></p>
           <div class="woo-sc-hr"></div>
           <br> 
           <em><strong>[10] SSL Security</strong> – A&nbsp;website with SSL security certificate ensures the connection between your visitors’ web browser and your website is encrypted, secure and protects your visitors’ information when they use your website. Having your website encrypted also&nbsp;improves your Google search rankings (SEO).</em>
           <p></p> 
           <ul> 
            <li><em><strong>Wix,&nbsp;Squarespace &amp; Jimdo</strong> – Free SSL certificates across all plans.</em></li> 
            <li><em><strong>Weebly</strong> – SSL certificates included only for the Business and Performance plans.</em></li> 
            <li><em><strong>GoDaddy</strong> – SSL certificates included only for the Business, Business Plus and Online Store plans.</em></li> 
           </ul> 
           <div id="SEO"></div> 
           <p></p>
           <div class="woo-sc-hr"></div>
           <br> 
           <em><strong>[11] SEO:</strong>&nbsp;</em>
           <p></p> 
           <ul> 
            <li><em><strong>Wix</strong>&nbsp;allows page level control, including H1 to H6 titles, and you can&nbsp;<a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/wixchartediturl" target="_blank" rel="noopener">customize your webpages’ URL</a> (webpage address) so search engines will better understand the purpose of your pages. Wix is also specifically highlighted&nbsp;in the <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wix-review/#seo" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Google Webmaster Guidelines</a> (next to WordPress), answering a common question as to whether Wix is search engine friendly.&nbsp;Click here to see a full overview of <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/wixseocompchart" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Wix’s SEO capabilities</a>.</em></li> 
            <li><em><strong>Squarespace</strong> gives you full control over page titles, meta descriptions, and custom webpage URL. &nbsp;It also has the “Google Author Rank” built into your profile to improve your search engine exposure &amp; site indexing. &nbsp;This is automatically done so you don’t have to manually insert snippets of codes into your site which is very convenient. &nbsp;</em></li> 
            <li><em><strong>Jimdo</strong> only allows page level title and meta description controls if you upgrade.</em></li> 
           </ul> 
          </div> 
         </div> 
         <div class="twocol-one last"> 
          <div class="woo-sc-box no-icon normal  rounded full" style="padding-left:15px;background-image:none;"> 
           <ul> 
            <li><em><strong>Weebly</strong> allows page level control and the ability for you to customize your webpage URL, but no H1 title tags (on page level). &nbsp;Do note that if you don’t upgrade to a paid Weebly plan, your website will not be indexed by search engines.</em></li> 
            <li><em><strong>IM Creator</strong> only allows you site wide SEO configuration, but not on a page level.</em></li> 
           </ul> 
           <p>Want more discussions about SEO? See our <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builder-seo-vs-wordpress-seo/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Website Builder SEO guide</a> here.</p> 
           <div id="export"></div> 
           <p><em><strong>[12] Export Website:</strong></em></p> 
           <ul> 
            <li><em><strong>Squarespace</strong> websites can be <a title="See how you can export Squarespace into WordPress" href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/squarespaceexportchart" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener">exported into WordPress</a>, allowing you to edit your content in WordPress without knowing codes.&nbsp;</em></li> 
            <li><em>For <strong>Weebly</strong> and <strong>IM Creator</strong>, you can export HTML / CSS codes to upload into your own host. &nbsp;But to edit your site, you will need to modify the codes yourself.</em></li> 
           </ul> 
           <div id="restore"></div> 
           <p></p>
           <div class="woo-sc-hr"></div>
           <br> 
           <em><strong>[13] Restore Website:</strong>&nbsp;</em>
           <p></p> 
           <ul> 
            <li><em><strong>Wix</strong> allows you to save unlimited versions of your website so you can restore your entire website anytime, even weeks after you’ve made a mistake.</em></li> 
            <li><em><strong>Squarespace</strong> allows you to restore deleted pages &amp; blog posts, up to 30 days after they’ve been deleted.</em></li> 
            <li><em><strong>W</strong><strong>eebly</strong> allows you to undo changes, but once you exit the editor or publish your website, you cannot undo any&nbsp;changes. If you’ve accidentally deleted your website or pages, you’ll need to email Weebly &amp;&nbsp;wait for them to restore the deletions. So unlike Wix or Squarespace, you can’t recover your deletions immediately.</em></li> 
           </ul> 
           <div id="support"> 
            <p></p>
            <div class="woo-sc-hr"></div>
            <br> 
            <em><strong>[14] Support:</strong></em>
            <p></p> 
            <ul> 
             <li><em><strong>Wix’s</strong> phone support is available across all plans (including the free plan)&nbsp;which is fantastic, and if you are a VIP plan user, you get access to their “VIP Team”. </em></li> 
             <li><em><strong>Squarespace</strong> provides 24/7 email support and answers you within 1 hour. &nbsp;Live chat support (Squarespace &amp; Weebly) only available during daytime.</em></li> 
             <li><em><strong>Weebly</strong> also recently introduced phone support.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</em></li> 
            </ul> 
            <div id="blog"></div> 
            <p></p>
            <div class="woo-sc-hr"></div>
            <br> 
            <em><strong>[15] Blogging:</strong></em>
            <p></p> 
            <ul> 
             <li><em><strong>Wix</strong> integrates Facebook commenting system and you can &nbsp;style your blog background, which is an added flexibility. &nbsp;</em></li> 
             <li><em><strong>Squarespace</strong> allows you to schedule when to publish your post (so you can write ahead of time). It can also connect &amp; automatically publish your blog post on your Facebook &amp; Twitter accounts. &nbsp;</em><em>Squarespace has the “Google Author Rank” built into your profile (to improve your search engine &amp; blog indexing), a spam blocker, built in integration with Disqus commenting system (if you don’t want to use Squarespace’s commenting system), and has multiple author support for guest postings.</em></li> 
             <li><em><strong>Weebly</strong> also allows you to schedule when to publish your post, as a spam blocker, as well as allowing you to choose between Disqus, Facebook or their own commenting system, giving you a bit more flexibility on which platform you’d like to use. IM Creator does not offer a blog system, so you need to set up your own blog elsewhere (such as on Tumblr or WordPress).</em><em>&nbsp;&nbsp;</em></li> 
            </ul> 
            <div id="ecommerce"></div> 
            <p></p>
            <div class="woo-sc-hr"></div>
            <br> 
            <em><strong>[16] e-Commerce</strong> –</em>&nbsp;
            <em>If you are building an online store, see our <a title="E-Commerce Online Store Builders Comparison Chart" href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/e-commerce-online-store-builders-comparison-chart/" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><strong>e-commerce builder comparison chart</strong></a>. &nbsp;Even though Wix has decent e-commerce tools, you can access even more powerful tools through the <a title="Wix App Market Review – Add more Functions to Your Wix Website" href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wix-app-market-review/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Wix App Market (our review)</a>, allowing you to bolt on powerful e-commerce platforms such as <a title="Shopify Reviews 2014 – Grow Your Online Sales" href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/shopify-reviews/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Shopify&nbsp;(our review)</a> or </em>
            <em><a title="Click to see Ecwid e-Commerce Tools" href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/ecwid" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Ecwid</a></em>.
            <em> &nbsp;Currently, GoDaddy and IM Creator do not offer any e-commerce features – but you can use 3rd party e-commerce software such as the <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/shopifybuybuttonlp" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Shopify Buy Button</a> or&nbsp;Ecwid&nbsp;to add e-commerce function to your website.</em>
            <p></p> 
            <div id="email"></div> 
            <p></p>
            <div class="woo-sc-hr"></div>
            <br> 
            <em><strong>[17] Email Service:</strong></em>
            <p></p> 
            <ul> 
             <li><em>For <strong>Wix</strong> and&nbsp;<strong>Weebly</strong>, you can get your own custom email address through <a href="https://www.google.com/work/apps/business/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener">Google Business Apps</a> (Gmail, but for businesses) for about $4 per month. </em></li> 
             <li><em>For <strong>Squarespace</strong>, if you sign up to their Annual Business or Commerce plans, you get one year free Google Business App to power your business email. This email account can be renewed for about $5 per month or $50 per year after your first year of free service. </em></li> 
             <li><em>For <strong>Jimdo</strong>, <strong>GoDaddy</strong> and <strong>IM Creator</strong> –&nbsp;</em><em>“Upgrade” means that email service is only included if you upgrade to the web builder’s premium plans.</em></li> 
            </ul> 
            <div id="newsletter"></div> 
            <p></p>
            <div class="woo-sc-hr"></div>
            <br> 
            <em><strong>[18] Newsletter Creator:</strong></em>
            <p></p> 
            <ul> 
             <li><em><strong>Wix’s</strong> newsletter creator is called <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/wixshoutout" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Shoutout</a>, which&nbsp;allows you to import email addresses from your Gmail or Outlook / Hotmail. You can also automatically insert addresses of people who has contacted you through your contact form, or those who purchased products from you. &nbsp;</em></li> 
             <li><em>To help you capture or collect your visitors’ email addresses, Wix has a <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/wixlightbox" target="_blank" rel="noopener">lightbox or popup function</a> to grab your visitors’ attention.</em></li> 
             <li><em><strong>Weebly’s</strong> newsletter creator is called <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/weeblypromote" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Weebly Promote</a>, and&nbsp;it is also synchronized to your contact list within Weebly. Both Wix and Weebly’s newsletter services are&nbsp;free if you are using their platforms to build your website. There are options to upgrade if you need additional features / emails to be sent out.</em></li> 
            </ul> 
            <div id="membership"></div> 
            <p></p>
            <div class="woo-sc-hr"></div>
            <br> 
            <em><strong>[19] Membership Creator</strong> – Wix and Weebly allows you to create a membership log in function, where your visitors can register to become members of your website. You can restrict webpages where only your members have access to them. This is a helpful tool if you want to create private clubs / classes, or just restrict content from being accessible by the public. </em>
            <p></p> 
            <ul> 
             <li><em>With <strong>Wix</strong>, you just add on their <a title="Click to see Wix's free membership login app" href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/wixmembership" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Member Login app (from their App Market)</a> to your Wix site and you can create an unlimited number of memberships. &nbsp;W</em></li> 
             <li><em>With <strong>Weebly</strong>, you&nbsp;can have up to 100 members with their Pro Plan or unlimited members with their Business Plan.</em></li> 
            </ul> 
            <div id="apps"></div> 
            <p></p>
            <div class="woo-sc-hr"></div>
            <br> 
            <em><strong>[20] Mobile Apps:</strong></em>
            <p></p> 
            <ul> 
             <li><em><strong><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/wixmobileapp" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Wix has a&nbsp;mobile&nbsp;app</a>&nbsp;</strong>where you can create and manage blog posts, manage your online store (track orders, add / edit products, receive sales notifications), interact with your visitors (get notifications when you receive a message, when someone books an appointment, etc.), or even start live chatting with your website visitors when they are on your website! Wix also has a mobile app for their newsletter function (</em><em><strong><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/wixshoutoutapp" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Wix ShoutOut app</a></strong>), allowing you to create newsletter directly on your mobile device to send to your newsletter subscribers. &nbsp;</em></li> 
             <li><em><a title="Click to see Squarespace's mobile apps" href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/squarespaceappchart" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><strong>Squarespace</strong> as 4 mobile apps</a>, allowing you to write blog posts, manage comments, monitor traffic, track social followers, showcase your galleries / portfolio as a presentation on your iPad / iPhone, and a note app so you can keep track of your ideas which syncs with your website, Evernote, Dropbox, Google Drive, etc. &nbsp;</em></li> 
             <li><em>The <a title="Click to see Weebly's mobile App" href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/weeblymobileapp" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><strong>Weebly</strong> App</a> allows you to build your entire website (with their&nbsp;iPad app), write blog posts, manage comments, monitor traffic, and manage products &amp; get sales notifications for your online store (using the iPhone &amp; Android app). With the iPad app, you can even create your Weebly site offline (without internet connection) so you can work anywhere.&nbsp;</em></li> 
             <li><em><a title="Jimdo iOS App – Making Website Building Mobile" href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/jimdo-ios-app/" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><strong>Jimdo’s</strong> mobile App</a> allows you to build / update your entire site (including blog posts) and monitor your traffic. &nbsp;It is the only App that allows you to build an entire website through the App.</em></li> 
            </ul> 
            <div id="editors"></div> 
            <p></p>
            <div class="woo-sc-hr"></div>
            <br> 
            <em><strong>[21] Multiple Editors </strong>– Wix,&nbsp;</em>
            <em>Squarespace &amp; Weebly allow you to add editors with different levels of access / authority rights to help you manage your website. &nbsp;You can set limits so some editors can’t access all parts of your website. This is a very handy tool if you plan on having a team to help you manage and/or build your site.</em>
            <p></p> 
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="clear"></div>
          <div class="woo-sc-divider flat"></div>
          <p></p>

        <script type="text/javascript">

      +function ($) {

			var elWrap = $(".fixedheader");
			var elMenu = $(".tablehead");
			var elFoot = $(".tablefoot");
			var elMain = $(".tablemain");
			var elWrapHeight = elMain.outerHeight();
			var osMenu = elMenu.offset().top;
			var osFoot = elFoot.offset().top + elMenu.height();

			$(document).ready(function() {
				elWrap.css("padding-top", elMenu.height());
			});

			$(window).scroll(function() {

			elMenu.css("top", 0);
			var edge = $(window).scrollTop();

			if (osMenu <= edge && osFoot > edge) {
			  elWrap.addClass("dock").removeClass("stop");
			} else {
			  elWrap.removeClass("dock stop");
			}
			if (elMain <= osFoot) {
			  elMenu.css("top", elWrapHeight);
			  elWrap.removeClass("dock").addClass("stop");
			}

			});

      }(jQuery);

		</script>

After years of trials &amp; errors using different website builders, we're here to share our experiences with you.

          <h4>Related Posts:</h4>

            <li class="post-id-7089"> <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wix-code-overview/" class="thumbnail"><img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/wix-code-thumb-50x50.jpg" alt="wix-code-thumb" width="50" height="50" title="6 Things You Need To Know About Wix Code" class="woo-image"></a> <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wix-code-overview/" title="6 Things You Need To Know About Wix Code" class="related-title"><span>6 Things You Need To Know About Wix Code</span></a> </li> 
            <li class="post-id-6370"> <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/shopify-pricing/" class="thumbnail"><img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/shopify-pricing-50x50.png" alt="shopify pricing plans review" width="50" height="50" title="Shopify Pricing Plans Review – Are They Really That Expensive?" class="woo-image"></a> <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/shopify-pricing/" title="Shopify Pricing Plans Review – Are They Really That Expensive?" class="related-title"><span>Shopify Pricing Plans Review – Are They Really That Expensive?</span></a> </li>

             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-317556"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi Carlene,</p> 
               <p>You absolutely should be able to move your domain name over to Squarespace, we’ve more information on this in our <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/what-is-a-domain-name-beginners-guide/">domain name discussion</a>.</p> 
               <p>As far as I am aware, you should also be able to migrate most of your WordPress site directly to Squarespace. It appears that Squarespace have even created <a href="https://support.squarespace.com/hc/en-us/articles/206543957-Importing-content-from-WordPress" rel="nofollow">this handy guide</a> to help you do this!</p> 
               <p>One thing to be aware of though is that if you plan on selling goods or services, you will need to subscribe to a <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/squarespaceplanspricing">Squarespace ecommerce plan</a>.</p> 
               <p>Hope that helps,<br> – Tom</p> 
              </div>

          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-tomwmvf even depth-2"> <a name="comment-317555"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-317555" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-317555"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/tom-wbe-profile-pic-285x284.jpg" width="40" height="40" alt="Tom Watts" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Tom Watts</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">September 21, 2017 at 1:12 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-317555" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-317555"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi Ben,</p> 
               <p>Good to hear you found the chart useful.</p> 
               <p>Your choice of website builder really depends on what you want to achieve with your site. What sort of on-site communication between partners do you envision? If it is just posting news updates then this will be much more easily achieved than if you want to embed an on-site live chat application. So it’s worth thinking about.</p> 
               <p>For what it’s worth, Squarespace would be a good choice if you are interested in a clean, professional website design as it lends itself to the creation of slick, beautiful sites with a high-end feel. So, definitely one to consider for your business on a looks front.</p> 
               <p>On the other hand, Wix offers you more versatility on the editing and site building front than Squarespace. Something to consider with Wix is the upcoming launch of <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wix-code-overview/">Wix Code</a>, which will help you to create large, engaging websites quickly and easily that otherwise would’ve required you to hire a professional developer. I mention this as you said your company is an international one, so it may need a larger site to host more content. Wix Code will also help you to create more custom forms and interaction to help you collect more information from users and partners too.</p> 
               <p>Wix’s prices do add to its popularity, but I believe it comes down more to ease of use and intuitiveness. While Squarespace is quite easy to get to grips with, Wix is the easiest website builder to pick up and start using. </p> 
               <p>Both offer you reliable security options, offering free SSL certificates for added security.</p> 
               <p>It might be worth reading our <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wix-review/">Wix</a> and <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/squarespace-review/">Squarespace</a> reviews too.</p> 
               <p>Hope that helps,<br> – Tom</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-317555" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-317555&quot;, &quot;317555&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Tom Watts">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div> 
            </article> 
           </div> </li>

           <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-317470"> 
            <div itemprop="text">
             <p>Super information – Thank you Thank you!!!<br> I too have a question – I have two websites (Organic Skin Care Co.) that are hosted my Lunar Pages :0 – both sites are WordPress that I built myself (a lot of time) one has e-commerce shopping cart (PayPal) not a lot of traffic and just starting- </p> 
             <p>Both sites have given me issues – (blank screen when I try to edit pages, to lost listings on the web, lack of e-mails being directed from the site to my gmail and now it looks like malware virus,) I understand this is probably due to building the site myself and not knowing a lot </p> 
             <p>Because of this I am thinking about going to a website builder / hosting that will make it easier for me to do updates, keep track of issues, and do backups. I realize this will be more costly but will free up my time to make products. </p> 
             <p>The most updates I am interested in doing myself is, adding pictures or products ( freshening up the site seasonally)<br> Square Space, Shopify, Indie made – could you point me in the right direction – is website builder correct direction –<br> Thank you again for all your site with great information.</p>

            <div class="reply"> 
             <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-317470" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-317470&quot;, &quot;317470&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Mary">Reply</a>

         <ul class="children"> 
          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-tomwmvf even depth-2"> <a name="comment-317496"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-317496" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-317496"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/tom-wbe-profile-pic-285x284.jpg" width="40" height="40" alt="Tom Watts" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Tom Watts</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">September 15, 2017 at 9:09 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-317496" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-317496"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi Mary,</p> 
               <p>Welcome to the discussion.</p> 
               <p>From the sounds of what you’re looking for, website builders sound like a good direction to head in.</p> 
               <p>I will point you towards our <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/e-commerce-online-store-builders-comparison-chart">ecommerce comparison table</a>, which should prove most helpful for you if you are looking to move your shops onto different platforms.</p> 
               <p>If your main tasks will be adding pictures and products (and you don’t need a highly sophisticated back end) then I would recommend looking at <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wix-ecommerce-review/">Wix’s ecommerce plan</a>, which is more basic than either Shopify or Bigcommerce – but covers the essentials like adding products, etc very well.</p> 
               <p>However, if you needed something a bit more in-depth and wanted to get stuck into reporting and growing your business quickly, then I would suggest <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/shopify-reviews/">Shopify</a> as the platform to do this on. The sheer scope of Shopify dwarfs most of its rivals when it comes to ecommerce functionality, so it is a very good bet if you are serious about growing your online stores.</p> 
               <p>I’ve linked to our ecommerce reviews for Wix and Shopify, so that should help you build up a better idea of what you should opt for.</p> 
               <p>Hope that helps,<br> – Tom</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-317496" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-317496&quot;, &quot;317496&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Tom Watts">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div> 
            </article> 
           </div> </li> 
         </ul> </li>

           <div id="li-comment-317491" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-317491">

             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Tom Watts</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">September 15, 2017 at 9:05 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-317491" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-317491"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi kim,</p> 
               <p>Glad to hear you found the discussion useful!</p> 
               <p>At this point in time it isn’t possible to export a website from Wix and take it elsewhere, either to another domain or to another website builder.</p> 
               <p>This is because your site and its content will have been created within the Wix platform and hosted on Wix’s servers, which just aren’t compatible with other builders.</p> 
               <p>You can copy all your text and store it in backup documents and also save copies of your imagery, but otherwise you would need to rebuild from scratch I’m afraid.</p> 
               <p>Thanks for reading,<br> – Tom</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-317491" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-317491&quot;, &quot;317491&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Tom Watts">Reply</a>

               <p>Hi John,</p> 
               <p>WordPress doesn’t fall into the same category of builder as the platforms we have reviewed on WBE. It tends to require more time and money commitments to achieve similar results as you are required to have a greater understanding of technical web building, including HTML and CSS.</p> 
               <p>Our aim is to look at website builders suited towards less-technically skilled users.</p>

             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/tom-wbe-profile-pic-285x284.jpg" width="40" height="40" alt="Tom Watts" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">

             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Tom Watts</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">September 12, 2017 at 1:51 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-317438" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-317438"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi Paul,</p> 
               <p>The Wix Editor lets you start with a template and then you have free reign to move elements wherever you like. The template is more of a jumping off point than anything else.</p> 
               <p>Whereas on Squarespace, you’re a little bit more restricted as to where you can put elements on the page and don’t have quite as much free reign to drag things wherever you want them.</p> 
               <p>Hope that clears things up,<br> – Tom</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply">

            <div itemprop="text">
             <p>Hello!</p> 
             <p>I stumbled upon your article by accident and it was extremely informative! Thank you so much for sharing!</p> 
             <p>I may have a bit of a strange question about website building…<br> I already have 2 websites (one was built by a friend) and I built the other one myself using WordPress. ALOT of frustration and tears building my site but I finished it. I’m not super happy with it and the sites are to promote books I’ve written (so I really need just a very simple website). The friend got me set up with WordPress and now I’ve lost touch with her. I’ve recently got an email from Sitelock stating that there is some vulnerabilities on the websites. I’m super stressed and confused about this. I went to FIVERR and contacted someone about fixing the vulnerability problem but he said my sites are very old technology and need some new coding (or whatever) to update them so it’ll cost me a few hundred dollars to update and fix each site.</p> 
             <p> Also, when I was signing into my WordPress.org dashboard using Firefox, it was warning me that if I was to plug in my password, it was not secure and could be compromised. I spent an hour researching out to deal with this problem and basically couldn’t find an answer. I used internet explorer to log in.</p> 
             <p>Is it possible to start both my websites fresh with Wix and get away from WordPress? Can I transfer my domain to Wix? What would be the easiest way to do this? </p> 
             <p>I appreciate any advise you have!</p> 
             <p>Thank you,<br> Romana</p>

         <ul class="children"> 
          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-tomwmvf even depth-2"> <a name="comment-317331"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-317331" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-317331"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/tom-wbe-profile-pic-285x284.jpg" width="40" height="40" alt="Tom Watts" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Tom Watts</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">September 4, 2017 at 1:05 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-317331" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-317331"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi Romana,</p> 
               <p>It sounds like you’ve had a tough time of it!</p> 
               <p>I’ll run through your questions and then make my suggestions.</p> 
               <p>So, first off your WordPress issues. I believe that if Sitelock, who I assume you have an account with, were good enough to contact you to let you know you have ‘vulnerabilities’ then they would be good enough to tell you what they are? This is doubly confusing because if the vulnerabilities were on the WordPress.org website then there’s no way they are ‘old technology’.</p> 
               <p>Secondly, your login and security issues – this is because your site does not have an SSL certificate, which you need to have in order to have ‘https’ in your web address. This essentially means you have a more secure connection that can protect visitors to your site. Contact your hosting partner and ask them about an SSL certificate – many companies offer them for free or very cheaply.</p> 
               <p>Now, if you are looking to move from WordPress I would thoroughly recommend Wix eCommerce to you. Not only is the editor an easy-to-use drag and drop editor (so what you see in the editor is what you see on the website!), but its ecommerce functionality is getting better and better. It’s not as in-depth as Shopify but it is robust enough to help you sell your books and manage the whole process without getting overly complicated.</p> 
               <p>It shouldn’t be an issue to move your domain either, <a href="https://support.wix.com/en/article/transferring-a-domain-purchased-elsewhere-to-wix" rel="nofollow">Wix even have a guide to doing this</a>.</p> 
               <p>We’ve got a more in-depth look at Wix eCommerce here.</p> 
               <p>Hope it helps,<br> – Tom</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-317331" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-317331&quot;, &quot;317331&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Tom Watts">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div> 
            </article> 
           </div> </li> 
         </ul> </li>

          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-tomwmvf even depth-2"> <a name="comment-317281"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-317281" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-317281"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/tom-wbe-profile-pic-285x284.jpg" width="40" height="40" alt="Tom Watts" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Tom Watts</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">August 31, 2017 at 8:56 AM</span>

           </div> 
           <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-317178"> 
            <div itemprop="text">
             <p>I would love your expert opinion. We currently have wix, but our non-for-profit group misses having an email thread that links from the website to inidividual member emails (similar to a yahoo group format). Our former subscription-based website format was really probelmatic (thus the switch to wix), but the forum with email thread was the only good desireable option. I have spent so much time searching for a site that will provide this for our group for little to no cost. Wix does provide a forum app that could possibly work, as well as our current use of a wix forum, but it would be nice to have an app or website that provides the email service WITHOUT having to link and open the actual message/post via having to go to our website. The emails provide a notification that a message has been posted, but does not allow the user to read it, without having to click and open it up elsewhere. I hope this makes sense. Would so appreciate your advice. Thanks kindly!</p> 
            </div>

           </div> 
           <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-316964"> 
            <div itemprop="text">
             <p>hey Gurpreet,</p> 
             <p>Thankfully websites and blogs aren’t mutually exclusive. There’s no reason why you can’t <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/how-to-build-a-website/" target="_blank">create a website</a> and dedicate a page to a blog.</p> 
             <p>For ease of use and blogging/writing capabilities I would suggest either <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/wixfree">Wix</a> or <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/weeblypricingplans">Weebly</a>, especially if you’ve no plans to monetize or look into ecommerce at this moment in time.</p> 
             <p>give the free trials a go and see how you get on.</p> 
             <p>– Tom</p> 
            </div>

             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-316726"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Thanks Grady, great to hear you found it handy.</p> 
               <p>Feel free to give it a share on social media if you like – just use the buttons above. You never know who else might find it useful!</p>

        <li class="comment byuser comment-author-tomwmvf odd alt thread-even depth-1"> <a name="comment-316671"></a> 
         <div id="li-comment-316671" class="comment-container"> 
          <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
           <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-316671"> 
           <div class="avatar">
            <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/tom-wbe-profile-pic-285x284.jpg" width="40" height="40" alt="Tom Watts" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
           </div> 
           <div class="comment-head"> 
            <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Tom Watts</span> </span> 
            <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">July 10, 2017 at 1:51 AM</span> 
            <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-316671" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
            <span class="edit"></span> 
           </div> 
           <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-316671"> 
            <div itemprop="text">
             <p>Hi prashanth,</p> 
             <p>Thanks for the feedback and for joining the discussion.</p> 
             <p>Sounds like you’ve had a bit of a frustrating time! This is an issue that crops up from time to time, but rest assured Wix SEO is as good as any other website creator. Google has even come out and said that there is no problem indexing Wix Websites in their search results – and that’s straight from the company itself, not a third party “SEO expert”. You can find some more information about this under the SEO section in our <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wix-review/">Wix Review</a>.</p> 
             <p>On the indexing front, unfortunately the time it takes to index a website varies from site to site, even if the websites being compared are all built with WordPress. </p> 
             <p>If you’re looking for a bit more information then take a look at this guide, which compares <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builder-seo-vs-wordpress-seo/">SEO across a number of website builders</a>.</p> 
             <p>You’re right that the Wix mobile site editor is a little bit more hard work, but it does give you more control than many over website creators – so it can be a bit of a catch 22 if you’re looking for a quick fix.</p> 
             <p>– Tom</p> 
            </div>

          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-tomwmvf even depth-2"> <a name="comment-316567"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-316567" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-316567"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/tom-wbe-profile-pic-285x284.jpg" width="40" height="40" alt="Tom Watts" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Tom Watts</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">June 30, 2017 at 3:57 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-316567" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-316567"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hey Eduardo,</p> 
               <p>Wix and Weebly both offer the functionality to build a membership site. With <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wix-review/">Wix</a> you can support an unlimited number of members from their free plan upwards – you jsut need the <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/wixmembership">Membership App</a>. A little tip though – you won’t have access to the full range of Wix tools if you stay on the free price plan.</p> 
               <p><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/weebly-review/">Weebly</a> on the other hand requires you to upgrade if you want to have membership functionality. You’ll get 100 invites on the Pro plan and an unlimited amount on the Business + Performance plans.</p> 
               <p>Check out the reviews I’ve linked to for Wix and Weebly before making a decision as both are great platforms and will be easier to manage than WordPress.</p> 
               <p>– Tom</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-316567" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-316567&quot;, &quot;316567&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Tom Watts">Reply</a>

          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-tomwmvf even depth-2"> <a name="comment-316560"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-316560" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-316560"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/tom-wbe-profile-pic-285x284.jpg" width="40" height="40" alt="Tom Watts" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Tom Watts</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">June 30, 2017 at 2:50 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-316560" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-316560"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hey Eduardo,</p> 
               <p>Wix and Weebly are the only 2 website builders that have built-in membership login functions.</p> 
               <p><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wix-review/">Wix</a> allows you unlimited members even on their free plan and you just need to add the <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/wixmembership">Membership App</a> to use this function. Bear in mind that you won’t get the full range of Wix tools if you remain on their free plan though.</p> 
               <p>With <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/weebly-review/">Weebly</a>, you’ll need to upgrade in order to invite members. The Pro plan allows up to 100 members, while the Business and Performance plans allow unlimited invites. </p> 
               <p>If you don’t mind external tools, you could use Sentry Login in combination with a Squarespace or Weebly site to create members functionality. However as it is not a native app, it may experience a few compability issues (not a guarantee, but something to be wary of!)</p> 
               <p>– Tom</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-316560" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-316560&quot;, &quot;316560&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Tom Watts">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div> 
            </article> 
           </div> </li>

        <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1"> <a name="comment-316290"></a> 
         <div id="li-comment-316290" class="comment-container"> 
          <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
           <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-316290"> 
           <div class="avatar">
            <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
           </div> 
           <div class="comment-head"> 
            <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
            <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">June 8, 2017 at 3:23 AM</span> 
            <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-316290" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
            <span class="edit"></span> 
           </div> 
           <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-316290"> 
            <div itemprop="text">
             <p>Hi Noemi,</p> 
             <p>Assuming if you don’t need any specialized tools and that you just want to build “basic” pages highlighting your services, contact information, etc, then any one of the website creators we’ve compared above will work. </p> 
             <p>Wix has a big library of design templates so they are a platform to start exploring. At the end of the day, I’d suggest you sign up for free / trial accounts with at least 2 website creators so you can get a good sense of what you like or dislike about them. It’s sort of like testing driving cars – you won’t know if you like it until you try them!</p> 
             <p>Jeremy</p> 
            </div> 
            <div class="reply"> 
             <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-316290" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-316290&quot;, &quot;316290&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
            </div> 
           </div> 
          </article> 
         </div> </li>

              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">June 5, 2017 at 1:19 PM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-316263" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-316263"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hey Rita,</p> 
               <p>If you decide to use Wix to create the website, you don’t have to change your email services at all. You can just keep your email service provider as is (don’t change), and just create your website using Wix. So in a way, you can mix and match your service providers. They are completely independent / separate items.</p> 
               <p>Hope this makes sense!</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-316263" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-316263&quot;, &quot;316263&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a>

          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor even depth-2"> <a name="comment-315839"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-315839" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-315839"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">April 21, 2017 at 10:56 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-315839" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-315839"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hey Lola,</p> 
               <p>Thanks for sharing your thoughts. Weebly is definitely a strong candidate if you want more flexibility to edit / add codes as they allow users access to the HTML and CSS codes. </p> 
               <p>However, Wix does have a fairly sizable <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wix-app-market-review/" target="_blank">app market</a> where you can bolt on additional marketing tools. I’m guessing you didn’t find what you need in the app market? </p> 
               <p>For Squarespace, it really depends on what external widget / apps you want to add. One method to quickly check is to search for the app name and the website builder’s name together. If there are discussions from the app creator about how to install it into a website builder, it will show up.</p> 
               <p>So if you are trying to install App XYZ into Squarespace, try searching “XYZ Squarespace”. Any relevant discussions will show up.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-315839" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-315839&quot;, &quot;315839&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
              </div>

            </article>

          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor even depth-2"> <a name="comment-315790"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-315790" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-315790"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">April 17, 2017 at 10:23 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-315790" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-315790"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hello James,</p> 
               <p>Wix and Weebly’s ecommerce plans do integrate with PayPal. To access this integration, you’d have to subscribe to Wix’s ecommerce or VIP plan, or Weebly’s Business or Performance plans.</p> 
               <p>As for Squarespace, they actually do integrate with PayPal now if you subscribe to their ecommerce plans. </p> 
               <p>We have an <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/e-commerce-online-store-builders-comparison-chart/" target="_blank">ecommerce comparison table</a> which will benchmark these website builders against each other from an ecommerce perspective.</p> 
               <p>You can also read what we have to say about their ecommerce features here (<a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wix-ecommerce-review/" target="_blank">Wix</a> / <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/squarespace-e-commerce-business-review/" target="_blank">Squarespace</a> / <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/weebly-ecommerce-review/" target="_blank">Weebly</a>).</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div>

            <div class="reply"> 
             <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-315563" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-315563&quot;, &quot;315563&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Becky">Reply</a>

         <ul class="children"> 
          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor even depth-2"> <a name="comment-315573"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-315573" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-315573"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">March 27, 2017 at 8:57 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-315573" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-315573"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hello Becky,</p> 
               <p>I’m glad you’re finding this comparison chart helpful.</p> 
               <p>As for capturing leads – Yes, both Wix and Weebly allow you to do so.</p> 
               <p>The mechanics are quite popular and simple – offer some sort of incentive (such as your documents) for people to sign up to your newsletter, then send them once they sign up.</p> 
               <p>Wix and Weebly both have their own built-in newsletter delivery system:</p> 
               <p>1) <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/wixshoutout" target="_blank">Wix Shoutout</a></p> 
               <p>2) <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/weeblypromote" target="_blank">Weebly Promote</a></p> 
               <p>We also have more details about these under Note 18 above. </p> 
               <p>Both enable you to create sign up boxes and configure your newsletters so they automatically deliver to your subscribers without you having to manually do so. In fact, Wix give you the ability to create lightboxes (pop up email sign up boxes). </p> 
               <p>Once you have the system set up, the whole cycle works automatically and really helps free up your time to do other things. More over, you can also add more to your newsletter series to keep in touch with your subscribers, to start building business relationships with them. All part of building up your business!</p> 
               <p>Hope this helps!</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-315573" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-315573&quot;, &quot;315573&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div> 
            </article> 
           </div> </li> 
         </ul> </li>

          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor even depth-2"> <a name="comment-315568"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-315568" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-315568"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">March 27, 2017 at 8:12 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-315568" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-315568"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hey Maureen,</p> 
               <p>Thanks for your note and we’re glad to hear that you’re finding our website helpful!</p> 
               <p>As for Squarespace, what you can experiment with is bolting on an external membership app called Sentry Login. I believe they can work with the Squarespace platform and basically adds the membership function to your website.</p> 
               <p>There are pros and cons with this approach, though. </p> 
               <p>Pros – You get to use Squarespace (if that’s who you end up choosing) and Sentry actually gives you the ability to charge your members monthly recurring membership fees. Although Wix enable you to setup members for free, it doesn’t have a feature where you can charge your members membership fees. </p> 
               <p>Cons – It’s an “external” app and so it might not be perfectly integrated with Squarespace. I generally prefer tools that are built by the website building platform so if anything goes wrong, they will fix it versus them not being able to fix any issues that might be created by external apps. </p> 
               <p>Also, Sentry is not free.</p> 
               <p>There are other membership apps out there as well. So make sure you do a search to see which one might be more suitable for you! Or, if you want to keep things simple and use a membership tool that is fully integrated with the website builder, Wix is a good option.</p> 
               <p>Hope this helps!</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-315568" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-315568&quot;, &quot;315568&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div> 
            </article> 
           </div> </li> 
         </ul> </li>

             <p>Wix and Squarespace each has its own pros and cons. The best way to know for sure is to sign up for trial accounts with both website builders and “play” with each platform to see which one you prefer working with. They’re free to try so why not, right?</p>

               <p>Hey James,</p> 
               <p>No, I haven’t used that before. It looks like a pretty specialized platform for digital marketing and online courses.</p> 
               <p>The website builders compared above (Wix, Squarespace, etc) are not as narrowly focused as Rainmaker. They’re more generic, flexible, and probably easier to use for people who don’t have specific needs for membership programs, selling digital courses, etc. </p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p>

         <ul class="children"> 
          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor even depth-2"> <a name="comment-315312"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-315312" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-315312"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">March 6, 2017 at 11:34 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-315312" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-315312"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hello Vaughn,</p> 
               <p>It’s hard to determine the exact 5 things you should look for. Perhaps think about what are the most important things you want to accomplish with your website (blogging, videos, images, galleries, etc) and prioritize them. Based on what you want on your website, sign up to a couple of test / trial accounts and see if you like using their platforms and if their tools are sufficient for your needs.</p> 
               <p>Even though the website builders above will deliver basic (and in some cases, more advanced) website building tools, you also have to be comfortable working with them. Each person will prefer a different website builder for unique reasons (different user interface, etc).</p> 
               <p>Hope this helps somewhat.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply">
