             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-315254"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi James,</p> 
               <p>I don’t think any one of them allow you to check how much bandwidth you’ve used. But do note that aside from certain Wix plans, all of the website builders give you unlimited bandwidth so you won’t have to worry about it. For Wix, most of their more popular plans such as the VIP and Unlimited plans give you unlimited bandwidth. </p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p>

           <div id="li-comment-315166" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment">

             <div class="avatar">

             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">February 22, 2017 at 8:33 PM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-315166" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-315166"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hey Mark,</p> 
               <p>Unfortunately there isn’t a way to import another website into Wix. Very generally speaking, since Wix is built on a proprietary platform, other websites are not coded in a similar way that it can function within Wix’s operating platform. This is why it’s very challenging and sometimes not possible to migrate a website from one website builder to another. </p> 
               <p>Have you considered signing up to a free account with Wix and testing them out? This way, if you like it better than GoDaddy, perhaps just start using Wix right away so you don’t have to worry about migrating a website from GoDaddy to Wix.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-315166" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-315166&quot;, &quot;315166&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a>

          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor even depth-2"> <a name="comment-315133"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-315133" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-315133"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">February 20, 2017 at 10:37 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-315133" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-315133"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi Daryl,</p> 
               <p>None of the website builders can help you stream your webinar directly on your website. I believe that most companies conduct webinars using dedicated tools such as GoToWebinar. </p> 
               <p>What they usually do is create a webpage to let people know when the webinar is and how to sign up. Once people sign up, they’ll receive an email to tell them when and which webpage to go to to watch the webinar. The webinar is hosted on tools such as GoToWebinar. </p> 
               <p>So websites only facilitate the process of ushering people to sign up to the webinar. It won’t stream the webinar directly.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-315133" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-315133&quot;, &quot;315133&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div> 
            </article> 
           </div> </li>

        <li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1"> <a name="comment-315081"></a> 
         <div id="li-comment-315081" class="comment-container"> 
          <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
           <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-315081"> 
           <div class="avatar">
            <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/Logo-Avatar.png" width="40" height="40" alt="" class="avatar avatar-40wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo avatar-default">
           </div> 
           <div class="comment-head"> 
            <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Kirsten Wellens</span> </span> 
            <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">February 15, 2017 at 10:15 AM</span> 
            <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-315081" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
            <span class="edit"></span> 
           </div> 
           <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-315081"> 
            <div itemprop="text">
             <p>In your footnotes ([14] Support:) you provided the following: Wix’s phone support is available across all plans (including the free plan) which is fantastic, and if you are a VIP plan user, you get access to their “VIP Team”.</p> 
             <p>As recent as a week ago, phone support is no longer provided with Wix regardless of the plan you have. Rather when you call their toll free number (800-600-0949), you get an automated message which, if you are calling from a cell phone, sends you a text message. Once you click on the text message, you are taken to their website where you can go through a series of Q&amp;A’s. If the answer is not there, you are allowed to generate a support ticket, however Wix is not responsive… at all. I generated a support ticket over 4 days ago and still have not received an email, text, or phone call back.</p> 
             <p>Truly a step down in terms of support for Wix as my past experiences with their customer and tech support were always positive. I am currently looking at other options to transfer my sites to. if I can’t speak with a technical support person when my site isn’t working, then what’s the point in doing business with Wix?</p> 
            </div> 
            <div class="reply"> 
             <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-315081" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-315081&quot;, &quot;315081&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Kirsten Wellens">Reply</a> 
            </div> 
           </div> 
          </article> 
         </div> 
         <ul class="children"> 
          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor even depth-2"> <a name="comment-315515"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-315515" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-315515"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">March 22, 2017 at 11:39 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-315515" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-315515"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi Kirsten,</p> 
               <p>Wix’s support portal now offers “Wix Quick Solutions” that guides you to specific help articles to address some of the most commonly asked questions. I think it’s just a way for them to streamline their support so they don’t become overwhelmed with phone calls when users can reasonably find help in their support center.</p> 
               <p>If you still can’t find a help guide that answers your question(s), there is a link at the bottom of the pop up box that says “Contact Us”. </p> 
               <p>Click on that and it offers you a callback phone support. Just insert your phone number and they will call you back. You’ll have to be logged into your Wix account in order to see this.</p> 
               <p>I just checked out this phone callback service and the next help agent available is in 10 minutes – not too bad.</p> 
               <p>Do note that their phone support is only available from 6pm – 5pm PST time zone.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-315515" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-315515&quot;, &quot;315515&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div> 
            </article> 
           </div> </li>

        <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1"> <a name="comment-314970"></a> 
         <div id="li-comment-314970" class="comment-container">

            <div itemprop="text">
             <p>Are Weebly and WIX the only web site creators that allow for Login applications on their sites?<br> Does WIX’ login app allow for unlimited # of members on their FREE site or does one have to be on one of their Premium sites to take advantage of this app?</p> 
            </div> 
            <div class="reply"> 
             <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-314965" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-314965&quot;, &quot;314965&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Joanne">Reply</a>

         <ul class="children"> 
          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor odd alt depth-2"> <a name="comment-314981"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-314981" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-314981"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">February 8, 2017 at 10:31 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-314981" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-314981"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hello Joanne,</p> 
               <p>Yes, Wix and Weebly are the only 2 website builders that have built-in membership login functions. If you don’t mind using an external membership tool, you can also check out Sentry Login which should work with most website builders. The drawback is that they are not “native” to the website builder so there is a chance that certain functions may cause conflicts (not saying that it will, but it’s a possibility).</p> 
               <p>For Wix, I believe that you can have unlimited memberships and you can add the app to your Wix site even if you are using the free plan. Of course, you won’t get the full range of Wix tools if you remain on their free plan. </p> 
               <p>For Weebly, you will have to upgrade to their Pro plan to be able to invite up to 100 members. If you want unlimited members, you’ll have to upgrade to their Business or Performance plans.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-314981" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-314981&quot;, &quot;314981&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div> 
            </article> 
           </div> </li> 
         </ul> </li>

          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor odd alt depth-2"> <a name="comment-314885"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-314885" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-314885"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">February 1, 2017 at 10:00 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-314885" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-314885"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi Leslie,</p> 
               <p>As far as I’m aware of, Squarepace is secure as they have a full time tech team to manage their platform and keep the security aspects of their platform updated. But of course, the best defense is to keep your password strong. The best practice to include alphabets, numbers and symbols, and to update your password once in a while.</p> 
               <p>Squarespace does offer you G Suite (basically Gmail for businesses) for a few dollars per month. It’s easy to set up and is fully integrated with your Squarepace account. We use G Suite ourselves as we like the reliability, stability and friendly user-interface of Gmail. </p> 
               <p>Hope this helps.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-314885" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-314885&quot;, &quot;314885&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div> 
            </article>

           <ul class="children"> 
            <li class="comment even depth-3"> <a name="comment-315247"></a> 
             <div id="li-comment-315247" class="comment-container"> 
              <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
               <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-315247"> 
               <div class="avatar">
                <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/Logo-Avatar.png" width="40" height="40" alt="" class="avatar avatar-40wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo avatar-default">
               </div> 
               <div class="comment-head"> 
                <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Bob Leedom</span> </span> 
                <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">February 28, 2017 at 4:57 PM</span> 
                <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-315247" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
                <span class="edit"></span> 
               </div> 
               <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-315247"> 
                <div itemprop="text">
                 <p>“The best practice to include alphabets, numbers and symbols…”<br> I think it’s generally agreed that length (12 or more characters) provides more security than complexity (requiring upper &amp; lower case, numbers, and symbols). Password-cracking tools can easily cycle through all the characters you can type, so you’re fooling yourself into thinking you’re more secure if, for example, you threw some capital letters into the mix, or you changed the letter “i” to a one, or the letter “o” to a zero.</p> 
                </div> 
                <div class="reply"> 
                 <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-315247" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-315247&quot;, &quot;315247&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Bob Leedom">Reply</a> 
                </div> 
               </div> 
              </article> 
             </div> 
             <ul class="children"> 
              <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor odd alt depth-4"> <a name="comment-315263"></a>

                 </div> 
                 <div class="comment-head"> 
                  <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
                  <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">March 1, 2017 at 11:10 AM</span> 
                  <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-315263" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span>

                   <p>Thanks for adding to this discussion!</p> 
                   <p>Jeremy</p>

        <li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1"> <a name="comment-314837"></a>

         <ul class="children"> 
          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor even depth-2"> <a name="comment-314842"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-314842" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-314842"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">January 29, 2017 at 10:13 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-314842" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-314842"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi there,</p> 
               <p>There are no limitations as to the size of the images that you upload. However, Wix does have storage space limitations. The higher the plan, the more storage space you get. </p> 
               <p>For instance, if you pick their lowest plan (the Connect Domain plan), you only get 500MB of space which isn’t a whole lot if you’re planning on uploading a lot of images. You get 20GB of storage space if you subscribe to their higher plans. So check out their <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/wixpremium" target="_blank">pricing page</a> for more details.</p> 
               <p>With Squarespace and Weebly, you get unlimited storage space if you subscribe to their paid plans. </p> 
               <p>Hope this helps.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-314842" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-314842&quot;, &quot;314842&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div> 
            </article> 
           </div> </li> 
         </ul> </li>

           <div id="li-comment-314796" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-314796"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">January 25, 2017 at 7:14 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-314796" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-314796"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Charlotte,</p> 
               <p>The top website builders highlighted above (Wix, Squarespace, Weebly) will all be able to do what you want. You can also add ecommerce functions later on when you’re ready. </p> 
               <p>In terms of design, Squarespace has the best looking designs. But if you want a broad selection of template designs and control, Wix is a strong candidate. They have over 500 designs, categorized by industries to help you narrow down the choices. You also have complete freedom to drag and drop content to wherever you want to on your pages.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-314796" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-314796&quot;, &quot;314796&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a>

              <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor even depth-4"> <a name="comment-314884"></a> 
               <div id="li-comment-314884" class="comment-container"> 
                <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
                 <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-314884"> 
                 <div class="avatar">
                  <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
                 </div> 
                 <div class="comment-head"> 
                  <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
                  <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">February 1, 2017 at 9:56 AM</span> 
                  <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-314884" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
                  <span class="edit"></span> 
                 </div> 
                 <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-314884"> 
                  <div itemprop="text">
                   <p>Charlotte,</p> 
                   <p>Yes – you’ll need to upgrade to a premium plan if you want to remove the logo advertisements. For Wix, just keep in mind that even with their “Connect Domain” plan, the logo will still be there. So you’ll have to upgrade to at least their “Combo” plan to get rid of the logo. We have more <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wix-pricing/" target="_blank">discussion about Wix’s pricing plans</a> here.</p> 
                   <p>Wix does offer you a blank template if you want to design your own design. It’s a useful option if you know exactly what you want and don’t mind investing the time to create it. It’s pretty simple as it’s all drag and drop, but it will take a bit of time as you are starting from scratch. Or else they have over 500 templates for you to choose from. </p> 
                   <p>Jeremy</p> 
                  </div> 
                  <div class="reply"> 
                   <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-314884" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-314884&quot;, &quot;314884&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
                  </div> 
                 </div> 
                </article>

             <p>Great info! I’m new to this (with some practice, I will be all the way up to novice level!). I’m trying to set up a site for our condo association using GoDaddy. For some reason their new vNext developer doesn’t allow the ability to put downloadable documents in your site. So, the only big feature we really need (ability of residents or potential buyers to download bylaws, rule books, newsletters, etc) is off the table. Absurd. </p>

          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor odd alt depth-2"> <a name="comment-314793"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-314793" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-314793"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">January 25, 2017 at 7:04 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-314793" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-314793"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi John,</p> 
               <p>If you just want to offer the ability for your website visitors to download files (including documents), Wix, Squarespace and Weebly allow you to do that as this function is fairly standard. </p> 
               <p>If you want to sell these documents (digital products), then Squarespace and Weebly will be more appropriate.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-314793" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-314793&quot;, &quot;314793&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div> 
            </article> 
           </div> </li> 
         </ul> </li>

            <div itemprop="text">
             <p>Great info on a very important topic. This saved me a lot of independent research and helped point me in the right direction. Thanks!</p> 
            </div>

            <div itemprop="text">
             <p>Hi Jeremy,</p> 
             <p>I’m having a hard time making a choice. I’m an author and need a site that will allow me to have a few pages (book with buy now buttons, bio, news, contact) and possibly a blog, nothing fancy. I don’t need commerce because I’ll be sending to external distributors. </p> 
             <p>I’d also like to be able to create a landing page, when necessary, to get people to sign up for my email list (not just a signup area on my homepage), and delete/hide or edit the landing page. I’m leaning toward Wix or Weebly since they offer built-in email capability, which is enticing. </p> 
             <p>I’ve been checking out the templates, especially the writers’ templates, on Wix. Any idea how much flexibility I’d have to change or add things. For example, if I like a certain template that doesn’t show a blogging section in their sample, would it be simply setting up a new page/section within the site to add it? </p> 
             <p>I use wordpress at work, but it was already set up for us; it’s fairly easy to use but I only have to create new posts and add text to them, nothing else. I was leaning away from wordpress mainly because of the amount of plugins necessary and the amount of time it would take for me to resize images, find the plugins, security updates, etc. </p> 
             <p>Also, any idea how Wix/Weebly email campaign services compare to something like Mailchimp as far as setting up campaigns and scheduling them? </p> 
             <p>Thank you, and thanks for this great site and the information!</p>

           <div id="li-comment-314698" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-314698"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">January 18, 2017 at 9:03 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-314698" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-314698"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hey Lin,</p> 
               <p>Thanks for your comment. The templates that Wix has are completely flexible. So you can just add a new blog page to the template and you can start blogging. </p> 
               <p>In terms of comparing Wix Shoutout and Weebly Promote (their built-in newsletter services) against Mailchimp, I think Mailchimp is probably more advanced as they are a “pure” newsletter service – meaning that’s all they do so they are focused. Also, some may say that Mailchimp will have better email deliverability but I haven’t seen any credible studies / comparisons. </p> 
               <p>That’s not to say that Wix Shoutout and Weebly Promote are any inferior. The benefit is that they are fully integrated within your website builder (whichever one you decide to use) and so you can manage everything under one single platform without having to log in separately to another service provider such as Mailchimp. You’ll also have certainty that your tools will be working perfectly without having to worry if there would be any potential conflicts. </p> 
               <p>Also, Wix Shoutout and Weebly Promote enable you to use the website builders’ drag and drop features to create your own designs. </p> 
               <p>At the end of the day, I suspect that integrating Mailchimp with either Wix or Weebly will probably be fine.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-314698" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-314698&quot;, &quot;314698&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a>

         <ul class="children"> 
          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor even depth-2"> <a name="comment-314680"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-314680" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-314680"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">January 16, 2017 at 7:31 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-314680" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-314680"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hello Christine,</p> 
               <p>Any one of the website builders above will allow you to write blog posts and track visitor statistics using Google Analytics. </p> 
               <p>However, if you want to enable newsletter function (to build your mailing list), you have a few options. Wix and Weebly have their own newsletter functions that are fully integrated into their own platforms – Wix Shoutout and Weebly Promote (see footnote 17 above for more details). </p> 
               <p>With Squarespace, while they don’t offer you a built-in newsletter function, you can connect external newsletter service providers to your website (such as Mailchimp or Aweber). </p> 
               <p>The advantages of using Wix or Weebly with their built-in newsletter system is that the functions are tightly integrated within their platforms. But I’ve seen Squarespace users integrate external systems, too, and I suspect they work just fine.</p> 
               <p>Regarding selling courses, Wix and Weebly both offer membership protected functions (see footnote 18 above) so this gives you the infrastructure to share webpages with only your students (and not with the public). Squarespace doesn’t have this function (yet), but if you want to consider integrating an external membership feature, take a look at Sentry Login. I haven’t used Sentry Login before but I heard it works fine. </p> 
               <p>Again, the risk with using an externally powered tool is that there is a chance that the tool may not be optimized for the website builder, versus an built-in tool that is tightly integrated with the website builder. The risk is not high based on what I’ve seen, but a risk nevertheless.</p> 
               <p>I do want to point out that with the membership functions for Wix and Weebly, neither one of them allow you to charge recurring membership fees. What I’m saying is that their membership features are not integrated with their ecommerce functions. So if you want to charge monthly recurring fees to allow your students to continue to access protected pages, then Sentry Login can help with that (which also works with Wix and Weebly).</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-314680" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-314680&quot;, &quot;314680&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div> 
            </article> 
           </div> </li> 
         </ul> </li>

           <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-314667"> 
            <div itemprop="text">
             <p>What website is the most Stripe-friendly service? We are trying to build our website for free while also retain our Stripe payments. We tried using Wix, but they don’t have Stripe payment. It seems you have to use third party integration services which continue to raise your fees. Is it possible anywhere to create your website for free (or small monthly plan) while using Stripe and their transaction fees BUT not having to pay the website builder or other third-party services to make these Stripe transactions? Thanks!</p> 
            </div> 
            <div class="reply"> 
             <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-314667" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-314667&quot;, &quot;314667&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to RJ Bacani">Reply</a>

         <ul class="children"> 
          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor even depth-2"> <a name="comment-314678"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-314678" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-314678"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">January 16, 2017 at 7:19 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-314678" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-314678"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hey RJ,</p> 
               <p>The cheapest option will be Weebly. You can connect your ecommerce store to Stripe with any one of their paid plans and the cheapest premium plan is the Starter plan for $8 per month (under their annual plan). </p> 
               <p>However, with the Starter plan, there is a 3% transaction fee charged by Weebly for each sale (in addition to the Stripe payment processing fee). To remove this fee, you’ll have to subscribe to at least their Business plan at $25 per month.</p> 
               <p>One option is to start with their Starter plan and see if your business does well. If it does, then you may have the financial resources to upgrade to the Business plan to save yourself the 3% if the math works (the 3% you save exceeds the pricing difference between the Starter and Business plans).</p> 
               <p>Another option is Squarespace. Their Personal plan is $12 per month (under their annual plan), and they also have a 3% transaction fee (on top of the Stripe payment processing fee). The next higher plan, the Business plan, charges a 2% transaction fee.</p> 
               <p>If your store does well, you can also consider moving up to their Online Store plans where there won’t be any transaction fees.</p> 
               <p>So to summarize, I’m not aware of a completely free website builder that enables you to connect to Stripe payment processor. </p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-314678" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-314678&quot;, &quot;314678&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div> 
            </article> 
           </div> </li>

            <div itemprop="text">
             <p>I always appreciate what I can learn from your website; thank you. </p> 
             <p>RE: What are the additional costs?<br> How about a comparison chart on the additional expenses one should expect from each web-builder in order to have a truly functioning website (e.g., detailing all that is or is not included). SquareSpace includes SSL with all their websites whereas Weebly will require installation of an app for a fee (through Weebly or another, such as GoDaddy, for example).</p> 
             <p>I’ve noted you and others find SquareSpace more expensive than say Wix &amp; Weebly, yet in the price charts comparisons I’ve made, Weebly can be more expensive in the higher end or so it appears. One needs to look on the websites’s pricing charts to see all their pricing lists (tedious) and ask the questions (e.g., “Does SquareSpace provide SSL”). I figure you are the ones who make this your business to assist and guide us, right?</p> 
             <p>I think I am ready to build on SquareSpace. Time will tell. My reasoning being because they provide the following: SSL with no additional fee, have added paypal, are considered the most elegant of website templates (although some say, “boring”) and seem possibly less expensive on the whole albeit Weebly does offer a zero monthly plan (unlimited), and SquareSpace also offers the flexibility of transferring to another website builder (e.g., WordPress). </p> 
             <p>Thank you for all your diligence and research.</p>

          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor even depth-2"> <a name="comment-314643"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-314643" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-314643"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">January 13, 2017 at 8:52 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-314643" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-314643"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi Lani,</p> 
               <p>Squarespace does include SSL for their websites as part of all their premium plans. With Weebly, you’ll get SSL only if you subscribe to their Business and Performance plans. </p> 
               <p>The reason why the price comparisons remain as they are is that even if you want to add SSL to Weebly’s lower plans, you won’t be able to. So from that perspective, outlining the various pricing scenarios won’t be helpful since one can’t add the SSL certificate anyway. </p> 
               <p>So I suppose if having SSL is one of the most important items to you, then you can compare Squarespace’s plans with Weebly’s Business and Performance plans, and not with Weebly’s lower plans.</p> 
               <p>In my view (at the moment anyway), having SSL is important only if you have a membership login function or have an ecommerce checkout page, in order to protect your visitors’ privacy. Both Squarespace and Weebly both have SSL protection for their ecommerce checkout carts across all plans, so you should be sufficiently protected from that perspective. </p> 
               <p>One thing to consider is that Google is encouraging that all websites have SSL, but I’m not entirely convinced that it is completely necessary (at the moment) if your website only presents information and doesn’t require your visitors to submit any passwords of private information. </p> 
               <p>Hope this helps!</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-314643" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-314643&quot;, &quot;314643&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div>

              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-314641"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi Tom,</p> 
               <p>This comparison table above only compares drag and drop website builders. We have a <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/e-commerce-online-store-builders-comparison-chart/" target="_blank">comparison table for ecommerce builders</a> here. Hope you find it helpful!</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply">

        <li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1"> <a name="comment-314446"></a>

           <div class="comment-head">

            <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-314446" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span>

           <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-314446"> 
            <div itemprop="text">
             <p>As a side project I’m looking to build a traditional news publisher site supported by third party advertising – services like adsense, media.net, outbrain/taboola, etc. I believe this is possible with WordPress, but I’m concerned about my lack of dev skills and want something easy. Any of the other website builders particularly good for third party ad integration? I’m also interested in being able to feature web search and customize the search box experience if possible. Thanks in advance for any guidance!</p> 
            </div> 
            <div class="reply"> 
             <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-314446" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-314446&quot;, &quot;314446&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Scott">Reply</a>

         <ul class="children"> 
          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor even depth-2"> <a name="comment-314453"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-314453" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-314453"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">December 30, 2016 at 9:46 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-314453" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-314453"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hey Scott,</p> 
               <p>I think all of the website builders above will support Adsense. But I’m not entirely sure about the other advertising platforms as I haven’t used them before. But if you only need to insert a snippet of code into your webpages to display these ads, then in theory it should be fine as these website builders have tools to allow you to insert external codes.</p> 
               <p>One way to find out for sure is to sign up for a free account and insert your advertising codes to see the ads show up.</p> 
               <p>They also offer search boxes but they’re pretty standard. If you want to customize your search experiences, you might need to use something like Swiftype that allow you control over what pages show up and what doesn’t, etc. So it enables you to have control over the search results within your website. Swiftype works with Squarespace and Weebly. But the monthly fee to enable this function is pretty pricey. </p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-314453" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-314453&quot;, &quot;314453&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div> 
            </article> 
           </div> </li> 
         </ul> </li>

              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hey Daniel,</p> 
               <p>If you can’t find a specific template that’s catered to what you’re trying to do, try finding the closest one and get started with that one. One thing about Wix is that they are very flexible when it comes to design so you can re-arrange items on your pages by just dragging and dropping them wherever you want to. So in a way, you can create your own listing layout based on the design you have in mind.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p>

              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">December 12, 2016 at 6:52 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-314261" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-314261"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hey D-J,</p> 
               <p>The top recommendations above are very easy to use and you don’t need any coding knowledge to build a professional looking website.</p> 
               <p>Specifically, Squarespace has a podcast feature where you can integrate your website with iTunes. </p> 
               <p>The other website builders (such as Wix and Weebly) have audio tools where you can upload your audio file on to any webpage, and your visitors can click on the audio player to listen to your show. </p> 
               <p>Hope this helps!</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div>

            <div itemprop="text">
             <p>Jeremy,<br> I’m planning to start a website wherein I will offer my eons of architectural drafting experience to create custom preliminary floor plans for folks planning to renovate or add to their homes.          <ul class="children"> 
          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor odd alt depth-2"> <a name="comment-314195"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-314195" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-314195"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">December 5, 2016 at 8:36 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-314195" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-314195"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi Gene,</p> 
               <p>I think any capable website builders (such as the ones listed above, including Squarespace) should be able to get the job done for you.</p> 
               <p>Sounds like you’re only looking to setup pages, blog posts, insert tutorials / information, link together some pages to guide people to different parts of your website. Squarespace can help you do that without you having to be technical at all. </p> 
               <p>Best way forward is to sign up for a trial account and give it a “test drive”. That’s the best way to find out!</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-314195" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-314195&quot;, &quot;314195&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div> 
            </article> 
           </div> </li> 
         </ul> </li>

             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-314163"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hey Ketaki,</p> 
               <p>I wouldn’t know as I wasn’t involved. Have you tried asking your hosting company? It’s very strange how they sell you a domain name but will not allow you to connect it to a website.</p> 
               <p>Have you thought of transferring the domain name to another domain name registrar (such as <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/godaddy" target="_blank">GoDaddy</a>)? From there, you can connect it to any website you build (including one built with Wix). </p> 
               <p>We have a <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/what-is-a-domain-name-beginners-guide/" target="_blank">domain name guide</a> that discusses about the pros and cons of transferring a domain name to a website builder or to a domain name registrar. It also contains other helpful basics about domain name you might be interested in reading.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div>

          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor even depth-2"> <a name="comment-313666"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-313666" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-313666"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">October 21, 2016 at 3:15 PM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-313666" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-313666"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi Steve,</p> 
               <p>Thanks for your comment. I guess it is somewhat subjective and varies from person to person. </p> 
               <p>I recall when I first started using Weebly years ago and I found that it was very user-friendly. I try to be as objective as possible when I rate them nowadays but there may be a possibility that I’m slightly biased based on my experiences with them. </p> 
               <p>I try my best to put myself in a beginner’s shoes when I rate them, and I also take into consideration the user-friendliness of other website builders in order to keep the scoring relative.</p> 
               <p>In any case, I really do appreciate your feedback. Relative to other website builders, I do believe Weebly is one of the easiest-to-use website builders available in the market today.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div>

             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span>

             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-313532"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hello Tammy,</p> 
               <p>It really depends on what you have in mind with the membership setup.</p> 
               <p>If you just want to grant access to certain pages to members, without having them pay for access (like a monthly subscription fee), then Wix and Weebly have such membership functions. </p> 
               <p>Both website builders also have ecommerce tools so you can sell products. But bear in mind their shopping carts are not connected to their membership functions so you can’t charge monthly membership fees.</p> 
               <p>If you want to create a system where you can charge monthly membership fees, then WordPress has a few options for you (such as the Wishlist plugin). Using WordPress is much more challenging than drag &amp; drop website builders. But it is more powerful and flexible if you don’t mind climbing a steeper learning curve. </p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-313532" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-313532&quot;, &quot;313532&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div> 
            </article> 
           </div> </li> 
         </ul> </li>

             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">October 5, 2016 at 2:30 PM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-313460" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-313460"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi Kat,</p> 
               <p>When it comes to making such extensive modifications, the website builders above are probably not suitable. </p> 
               <p>if anything, I’d check out <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/e-commerce-online-store-builders-comparison-chart/" target="_blank">Shopify or BigCommerce</a>, if you want to keep with hosted ecommerce builders (where you don’t have to manage hosting and other technical aspects of operating your website). They are pure ecommerce builders so you get a lot more ecommerce related tools.</p> 
               <p>If those can’t be tailored to your specific needs, then you might need to pursue more <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/ecommerce-solutions/" target="_blank">customizable platforms</a>, which are more flexible but need a lot more maintenance and are technically challenging. </p> 
               <p>Hope this points you in the right direction.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-313460" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-313460&quot;, &quot;313460&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a>

           </div> 
           <div class="comment-head"> 
            <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Heather</span> </span> 
            <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">September 22, 2016 at 11:49 AM</span>

            <div itemprop="text">
             <p>Love this chart! Very helpful. I’m about to set up my first website. Just some quick questions regarding Wix:</p> 
             <p>1. In the “Responsive Themes” row, Wix has an X. Does this mean they don’t have mobile-responsive themes? That seems unlikely. I want to make sure my visitors can see all my content easily on their phones.</p> 
             <p>2. In the “Mobile App” row, it says Wix will allow me to work on a newsletter from my ipad. Is that the only editing / managing I can do on a mobile device using Wix?</p> 
             <p>3. In the “Export Website” row, there is an X for Wix. Does this mean my website could not be exported if needed? Am I reading that right?</p> 
             <p>4. Wix does not have online chat. Do you think that’s something they’ll bring on board? Online chat is one of my favorite tech help features!</p> 
             <p>Thanks for your expertise!</p>

         <ul class="children"> 
          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor even depth-2"> <a name="comment-313318"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-313318" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-313318"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">September 23, 2016 at 9:17 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-313318" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-313318"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi Heather,</p> 
               <p>Glad you’re finding this chart helpful to you!</p> 
               <p>1) Wix doesn’t offer responsive templates. But they do offer a dedicated mobile editor so that your website is mobile ready. <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/mobile-editor-review-wix-weebly-squarespace-jimdo/" target="_blank">We have a guide here</a> on comparing Wix’s mobile editor to other website builders’ responsive designs. It’s an intro guide so it will highlight some pros &amp; cons.</p> 
               <p>2) In addition to the app to help you manage your newsletter function (Wix Shoutout), Wix actually has an iOS app where you can receive instant notification when someone contacts you through your website, follow up on activities such as online store purchases or hotel reservations (so depends on what business you are operating), upload images on the go, etc. Visit their <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/wixsupport" target="_blank">support portal</a> and search for “Mobile App” and you’ll see more about it.</p> 
               <p>3) Correct. The main reason is that once your website exits Wix’s proprietary drag and drop platform, the other hosts won’t have the same infrastructure to help you manage your website the same way as how you would with Wix. Even with Weebly, it only export in codes so any modifications you’ll have to edit the codes directly. If this is important to you, check out Squarespace as they allow you to export most content into a WordPress friendly format.</p> 
               <p>4) They don’t have a “native” online chat tool, but you can find multiple chat tools in <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/wixapp" target="_blank">their App Market</a> that you can bolt on to your Wix site.</p> 
               <p>Hope this helps!</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-313318" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-313318&quot;, &quot;313318&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div> 
            </article> 
           </div> </li>

             <div class="avatar">

             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">September 14, 2016 at 1:23 PM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-313226" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-313226"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hello Jeanette,</p> 
               <p>I have yet to see a drag &amp; drop (code free) website builder have the ability for you to create databases, and create forums from scratch. However, platforms such as Wix or Weebly offer you apps where you can “bolt on” a forum to your website. </p> 
               <p>Wix has a couple of options so check out their <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/wixapphome" target="_blank">App Market</a> and search for “forum”.</p> 
               <p>As for your last question, if you switch website builders, you will have to re-create your content from scratch. In terms of your domain name, you can just disconnect it from your existing website and connect it to your new website. We have a <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/what-is-a-domain-name-beginners-guide/" target="_blank">domain name guide</a> here that you might find helpful.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-313226" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-313226&quot;, &quot;313226&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
              </div>

            </article>

             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-313185"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hey Roz,</p> 
               <p>Thanks for your note. It’s not unusual to feel that building a business online is overwhelming – it was for us at first as well! It gets much easier over time when things start to “click”. Hopefully you’re finding our discussions here helpful.</p> 
               <p>Wix will definitely not be as flexible as Shopify, as Shopify in our view, is probably the <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/shopify-reviews/" target="_blank">best hosted ecommerce builder</a> in the market today. They’re flexible, powerful and has the ability to grow with you as your business expands. So while they’re not the cheapest option around, they’re scalable and reliable which are also factors you should consider as you grow your business.</p> 
               <p>On a side note, we published a guide on <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/ecommerce-product-page-design-part-1/" target="_blank">how to craft an awesome product page</a> here. Hopefully you’ll also get some tips out of it!</p> 
               <p>Thanks for commenting.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-313185" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-313185&quot;, &quot;313185&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a>

           </div> </li> 
         </ul> </li>

I have noticed that Bing does not always show all of the sites out there.</p>

We don’t want to loose our .vine or .wine since these domain extensions were being limited. We do have a .com too. We also want our emails with our domain, myname@victoriansummit. com. </p>

          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor even depth-2"> <a name="comment-313153"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-313153" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-313153"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">September 9, 2016 at 3:06 PM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-313153" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-313153"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hello Victoria,</p> 
               <p>I think Squarespace is a really good choice for creatives (such as yourself). You don’t need to know how to code and you can still build a really good looking website with Squarespace. </p> 
               <p>You can certainly connect your domain name from GoDaddy to your Squarespace website. Squarespace’s help center will have tutorials on how to do that. </p> 
               <p>You can also connect your email addresses as well as Squarespace does offer you the ability to use Google Business Apps (basically the Gmail user interface) to power your custom email addresses. It’s only a few dollars a month, which is affordable.</p> 
               <p>When it comes to WordPress, it is a powerful and flexible website builder. However, if you’re not proficient with codes or if you don’t plan on hiring a coder to help you, I’d suggest giving Squarespace a trial run first. We have a much more detailed <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/squarespace-vs-wordpress/" target="_blank">comparison between Squarespace and WordPress</a> here. I think you’ll find it insightful.</p> 
               <p>As for SEO (helping your website become more searchable by search engines), take a look at our <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builder-seo-vs-wordpress-seo/" target="_blank">website builder SEO guide</a> here. I think yo’ll also find this helpful.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-313153" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-313153&quot;, &quot;313153&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a>

           <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-313115"> 
            <div itemprop="text">
             <p>Hi Jeremy,</p> 
             <p>Thanks for providing so much detailed info. Your site is super helpful! </p> 
             <p>I’ve narrowed my choices down to Weebly or Wix. I’ve been playing around with both editors and so far I am finding Weebly more easy to use. I’m also finding the written response times of Weebly support to be way faster (minutes rather than days). That said, there are a few things above that are keeping me undecided. My sites will be a store/blog, with both elements being equally important. </p> 
             <p>You mentioned above: “Weebly IM Creator does not offer a blog system, so you need to set up your own blog elsewhere (such as on Tumblr or WordPress)”. Please can you explain what you mean by this? </p> 
             <p>Also, you say that you get Wix phone support even on their free plan. I don’t see a support number anywhere on Wix’s site or Facebook page. In fact, I had to keep popping into their Page to nudge them to reply to my emails. I’m curious to know how you and others find Wix support to be? </p> 
             <p>Finally, you mention that Weebly is less SEO friendly. Is this something I ought to consider? I’d love to hear from you an other Weebly users how they found their SEO to be?</p> 
             <p>Thanks in advance,<br> Steph</p>

          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor even depth-2"> <a name="comment-313147"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-313147" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-313147"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">September 9, 2016 at 2:52 PM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-313147" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-313147"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hey Steph,</p> 
               <p>IM Creator doesn’t offer a blogging function, but Weebly does. So you can definitely create a blog with Weebly. </p> 
               <p>As for Wix’s phone support, if you visit their support center and type in “phone support” you should be able to find it. Click on “Schedule a Call” or “Call Us Directly”</p> 
               <p>We found Weebly’s SEO to work just fine, but Wix has a bit more flexibility especially when it comes to being able to customize your webpage URLs. When it comes to SEO in general, have a look at our <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builder-seo-vs-wordpress-seo/" target="_blank">website builder SEO guide</a> here. It will offer you a bit more insights.</p> 
               <p>At the end of the day, Weebly is easier to use than Wix, but we think that Wix offers a lot more updated and advanced features, which are also pretty easy to use. Weebly is a solid website builder for sure, but Wix is much more innovative. Have a look at the introduction section of our <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wix-review/" target="_blank">Wix review</a> here for more details about what we think about Wix.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div>

              </div>
