         <ul class="children"> 
          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor odd alt depth-2"> <a name="comment-289206"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-289206" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-289206"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">March 24, 2015 at 11:04 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-289206" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-289206"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi Bilal,</p> 
               <p>It sounds to me what you need is a very customized solution. So none of the website builders that we’ve discussed here will enable you to do that. You can try looking for capable developers on <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/elance" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Elance</a> or <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/odesk" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">oDesk</a>, but make sure you know exactly what you want, including functionality, mock ups / drawings of how you want your user interface to be, etc, so that you can get a quote from some of the developers!</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-289206" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-289206&quot;, &quot;289206&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div> 
            </article> 
           </div>

               </div> 
               <div class="comment-head"> 
                <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Bilal Green</span> </span> 
                <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">March 24, 2015 at 2:31 PM</span> 
                <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-289265" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
                <span class="edit"></span> 
               </div> 
               <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-289265"> 
                <div itemprop="text">
                 <p>Hi there ,Thank you very much for your reply Jeremy,<br> i actually did post a job proposal on Elance and i got one Indian website designer biding at 2500 usd for the website and the logo,and one from a “developed country” designer (as you said in one of your articles) at 80 bucks an hour for the website only without precising the number of hours needed.<br> can i have your opinion please on the price asked by the Indian designer and also what’s the number of hours needed for a developer to build a website if you had to guess ?<br> Thanks again; the information on your website are very valuable.</p> 
                </div> 
                <div class="reply"> 
                 <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-289265" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-289265&quot;, &quot;289265&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Bilal Green">Reply</a>

             <ul class="children"> 
              <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor odd alt depth-4"> <a name="comment-289675"></a> 
               <div id="li-comment-289675" class="comment-container"> 
                <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
                 <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-289675"> 
                 <div class="avatar">
                  <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
                 </div> 
                 <div class="comment-head"> 
                  <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
                  <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">March 25, 2015 at 2:27 PM</span> 
                  <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-289675" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
                  <span class="edit"></span> 
                 </div> 
                 <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-289675"> 
                  <div itemprop="text">
                   <p>Hi Bilal,</p> 
                   <p>It’s really hard to say, and I do appreciate how challenging it is to hire a developer especially the first time around. There are many many factors that gets factored into the quote, including how complex of a site you want, what platform you want to build it on, etc. </p> 
                   <p>I would say that US$2,500 is what I would expect from an emerging country, but know that if you want to make changes, add a few things here and there, then costs will start to add up. Also, in my experience, they can get the job done, but that’s about it. So don’t expect them to have any creative input into the process, or write very clean code. They will be there to do what you tell them to do. Of course I’m sure not all Indian developers are like that, so I’m just generalizing based on our own experiences.</p> 
                   <p>As for the other designer (US$80/hr), I would suggest that you lock in the scope of the work, and know exactly what you want so he/she can give you more of an accurate quote. There’s always the debate between hiring on a per hour basis, or a fixed fee. There are a lot of good discussions about this topic and I’m sure you can find more info about that with a Google search. </p> 
                   <p>But if I was to generalize and guess, I’d say for a good developer in a developed country, I’d say a decent custom website will cost anywhere from $5,000 to $10,000 to get developed. It really depends on what you are trying to build. And this range can quickly go into $10,000+ if you hire really strong developers who know what they’re doing and write very good code.</p> 
                   <p>And of course, you can never get assurance that you will get what you want. But you can help mitigate uncertainty through interviews, looking at his/her portfolio, maybe even asking for references, and also, have a very clear scope of work so to minimize any disputes.</p> 
                   <p>Jeremy</p> 
                  </div> 
                  <div class="reply"> 
                   <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-289675" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-289675&quot;, &quot;289675&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
                  </div> 
                 </div> 
                </article> 
               </div>

            <div itemprop="text">
             <p>I am thinking I want to use squarespace for my medical intuitive RN website. I will be offering various medical advice information and also consulting. I will be asking for donations for those that cannot pay and fee for personal consultation. </p> 
             <p>On top of being an RN, I am a jewelry and interior designer. Is it possible to use squarespace for medical intuitive RN consulting and also sell jewelry for donations on same site? Does square space own my website or have rights to it? Also, I have already purchased a domain via google.domain. how do I incorporate it here? I received your informational book on line a while back and thank you for your insight. i decided to return to your site to get started on my websites….(This is the first one and then I need to make a few others for Rare Disease and a personal one) Im wondering if I should use different web builders for the various sites or stick to one! help me out please! </p> 
             <p>Thank You Tiffany</p>

         <ul class="children"> 
          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor odd alt depth-2"> <a name="comment-284392"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-284392" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-284392"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">March 13, 2015 at 8:12 AM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-284392" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-284392"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi Tiffany,</p> 
               <p>You can certainly create a site with both RN consulting and also sell jewelry at the same time. But from a branding / business perspective, I’m not too sure if you should do that? If both products / services are complimentary, then I’d say go for it. But in this case, I’m not entirely sure if that’s a good idea (but that’s just my humble opinion without knowing too much about what you do). So do consider creating separate websites for them, so you can brand your businesses individually. People who like jewelry might not need nursing material, and so having both in one single website can be very confusing for some visitors.</p> 
               <p>As for domain names, you can certainly connect it to a Squarespace site. <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/go/squarespacechart" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">If you visit Squarespace’s help page</a>, just type in “Domain” and you’ll get some tutorials on how to connect them.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-284392" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-284392&quot;, &quot;284392&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
              </div> 
             </div> 
            </article> 
           </div> </li> 
         </ul> </li>

          <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor even depth-2"> <a name="comment-283031"></a> 
           <div id="li-comment-283031" class="comment-container"> 
            <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-283031"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">March 10, 2015 at 4:00 PM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-283031" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-283031"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hi Sheila,</p> 
               <p>So do you need a shopping cart function? You mentioned that you didn’t have one, but then said you have a lot of products to sell.</p> 
               <p>In any case, if you are going to have a lot of products and want to update them efficiently, you should definitely have a look at Shopify (<a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/e-commerce-online-store-builders-comparison-chart/" title="E-Commerce Online Store Builders Comparison Chart" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">you can see our comparison chart for ecommerce builders here</a>).</p> 
               <p>Shopify is an “approved” shopping cart with WordPress.com – meaning that if you build an ecommerce store with WordPress.com, you can use Shopify to help you process payments. But if you use Shopify on its own, it’s just a standalone online store builder and won’t have anything to do with WordPress. </p> 
               <p>Hope this points you in the right direction!</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-283031" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-283031&quot;, &quot;283031&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a>

           <div id="li-comment-283024" class="comment-container">

             <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-283024"> 
             <div class="avatar">
              <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">

             <div class="comment-head"> 
              <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
              <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">March 10, 2015 at 3:50 PM</span> 
              <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-283024" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
              <span class="edit"></span> 
             </div> 
             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-283024"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Hey Harry,</p> 
               <p>If you want a functional mobile site, any of the top 3 website builders we highlighted above will work. Squarespace’s templates are all mobile responsive, so they look great across all mobile devices. Wix and Weebly has their own mobile editors. But Wix has a lot more design templates for you to choose from than Weebly. But out of all 3 of them, Weebly has the easiest user interface.</p> 
               <p>It’s important to sign up for a few free accounts and just spend some time to see which one you like the best. <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wix-vs-weebly-vs-squarespace-vs-jimdo/" title="Wix vs Weebly vs Squarespace vs Jimdo – Pros and Cons of Each" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Each one of them has its own pros and cons</a>, and all their user interfaces are different. So while one person may prefer Squarespace, another person may prefer Wix or Weebly.</p> 
               <p>So all of them allow you to create a mobile site. But you should pick one that you’re the most comfortable with.</p> 
               <p>Jeremy</p> 
              </div> 
              <div class="reply"> 
               <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-283024" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-283024&quot;, &quot;283024&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
              </div>

        <li class="comment byuser comment-author-websitebuilderexpert bypostauthor odd alt thread-even depth-1"> <a name="comment-282323"></a> 
         <div id="li-comment-282323" class="comment-container"> 
          <article itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Comment"> 
           <meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#li-comment-282323"> 
           <div class="avatar">
            <img src="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/jeremy_dec_2015.png" width="40" height="40" alt="Jeremy Wong" class="avatar avatar-40 wp-user-avatar wp-user-avatar-40 alignnone photo">
           </div> 
           <div class="comment-head"> 
            <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"> <span class="name" itemprop="name">Jeremy Wong</span> </span> 
            <span class="date" itemprop="datePublished">March 9, 2015 at 10:27 AM</span> 
            <span class="perma"><a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/website-builders-comparison-chart/#comment-282323" title="Direct link to this comment">#</a></span> 
            <span class="edit"></span> 
           </div> 
           <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-282323"> 
            <div itemprop="text">
             <p>Hi Mike,</p> 
             <p>Generally speaking, using WordPress is a good option if you aren’t afraid of climbing are pretty steep learning curve (as compared to website makers that we discuss on our website). If you want to build your store yourself with WordPress, you’ll have to be fairly technical and helps to know codes. Making changes / edits to your design or backend functions on WordPress to customize your store will require modifying codes. </p> 
             <p>It’s either that or you can hire a coder to help you with this, but good WordPress developers are not cheap (and you don’t want to pay for a cheap one as it can cause you even more pain (mental and financial) if you pick up the wrong developer!)</p> 
             <p>If WordPress is not for you, there are several good online store builders that can help you get your ecommerce store up without you having to be technical at all. <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/e-commerce-online-store-builders-comparison-chart/" title="E-Commerce Online Store Builders Comparison Chart" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">We have a comparison table for ecommerce builders here and you can take a look to see which one best suits your needs</a>.</p> 
             <p>If you need an advanced store and tools, check out Shopify and Bigcommerce. If you want a relatively simple store, then Wix, Weebly or Squarespace can be helpful here.</p> 
             <p>In general, the non-WordPress ecommerce builders are there to help you take care of all the technicalities of hosting and building websites. Whereas with WordPress, you’ll have to spend time and energy to maintain all the technicalities of operating a website. </p> 
             <p>We have a few discussion articles comparing a few website makers and WordPress. <a href="https://www.websitebuilderexpert.com/category/wordpress/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">You can see them here</a>.</p> 
             <p>Jeremy</p> 
            </div> 
            <div class="reply"> 
             <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="#comment-282323" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;comment-282323&quot;, &quot;282323&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;1171&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Jeremy Wong">Reply</a> 
            </div> 
           </div> 
          </article> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1"> <a name="comment-281851"></a> 
         <div id="li-comment-281851" class="comment-container">

Would you kindly advise us. Many thanks.</p> 
             <p>Mike.</p>

             <div class="comment-entry" id="comment-309434"> 
              <div itemprop="text">
               <p>Please don’t use WordPress. I have so many clients coming to me to untangle the WordPress mess it’s incredible! Stick with something user friendly like Weebly or Wix. Personally, I’m a Weebly fanatic and try touse it for all of my clients, even teach them how to do it themselves. WordPress is a nightmare.</p> 
              </div>
